name: polymerase

an enzyme (= a chemical substance produced by living cells) that causes the production of a polymer (= a chemical substance consisting of large molecules made from many smaller and simpler molecules ): To carry out its instructions, RNA must be decoded by an enzyme called polymerase. See also
polymerase chain reaction
More examplesFewer examplesThe technique uses the enzyme DNA polymerase to copy selected sequences over a million times.It interrupts DNA synthesis and function by inhibiting DNA polymerase and incorporating into the DNA or RNA of the cell.They attack HBV polymerase, an enzyme essential to the reproduction of the hepatitis B virus inside an infected cell.
